entries.title: 12 dead in Peru clashes between protesters and security forces
entries.description: Anti-government protesters trying to overrun an airport clashed with security forces on Monday, in the southeastern city of Juliaca. The demonstrators were demanding the departure of President Dina Boluarte, who took over after the ouster and arrest of then-president Pedro Castillo in December.

entries.title: French government refuses to ban Sunday hunting
entries.description: The plan, presented on Monday by the Junior Minister to the Minister of Environmental Transition, Bérangère Couillard, has left groups supporting the establishment of one non-hunting day a week disappointed.

entries.title: Les Bleus captain Hugo Lloris retires from international football
entries.description: The team's goalkeeper told French daily 'L'Equipe' that he would rather 'go on top, having helped France get to a World Cup final.'

entries.title: Donors pledge over $9 bn for Pakistan after catastrophic floods
entries.description: Donors at a Geneva conference committed more than $9 bn to help Pakistan recover from devastating floods, in which eight million people were displaced and millions of acres of agricultural land were ruined.

entries.title: In France's universities, the climate crisis clashes with academic culture
entries.description: A lack of training on the climate crisis for professors in French universities is one of the main obstacles to making higher education at the forefront of leading the climate transition.

entries.title: 'A major achievement': Ozone layer back on track for full recovery
entries.description: Thanks to the Montreal Protocol signed in 1987, the protective barrier should be fully restored within four decades. The ban on certain chemicals has benefited the fight against climate change by reducing ozone depletion.

entries.title: Gareth Bale announces retirement from football
entries.description: 'I feel incredibly fortunate to have realized my dream of playing the sport I love,' said the Wales captain who announced he was retiring from football, at the age of 33, on social media.

entries.title: Security forces under scrutiny after 'foreseeable' Brazil riots
entries.description: More than 1,200 pro-Bolsonaro rioters have been detained by Brazil's securty forces, but the police are under scrutiny after what some local newspapers have dubbed the 'worst attack on Brazilian democracy' in decades.

entries.title: At CES in Las Vegas, French innovations are at the forefront
entries.description: Under the banner of French Tech at the Consumer Electronic Show, the country showcased its commitment and support for innovative start-ups

entries.title: Germany and France summon Iran envoys over protester executions
entries.description: Iran on Saturday executed two more men in connection with protests sparked by the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in custody.

entries.title: Why the insurgency attempt in Brazil resonates with Trump supporters
entries.description: Strong ties have existed for several years between the Trump and Bolsonaro camps. Those close to the former American president see Brazil as a preferred battleground.

entries.title: Brazilian officials vow crackdown on pro-Bolsonaro rioters
entries.description: So far, more than 1,200 people have been detained after crowds stormed and ransacked Congress, the Supreme Court and presidential palace in Brasilia on Sunday.

entries.title: French duo on trial for foiled attack prior to 2017 election reveal little of their mysterious history
entries.description: Mystery surrounds the two defendants, Mahiedine Merabet and Clément Baur, who have multiple identities and differing defenses.

entries.title: Danone taken to French court by environmental campaigners over plastic use
entries.description: The NGOs behind this groundbreaking lawsuit are accusing the food giant, one of the largest users of plastic in the world, of not having a clear 'deplastification' plan.

entries.title: Japan faces the dilemmas of its military power
entries.description: Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has begun a series of meetings in Europe and North America to present Japan's new defense doctrine.

entries.title: Martial arts, war and repression in Chechnya
entries.description: Mixed martial arts has become a fundamental tool in Chechen dictator Ramzan Kadyrov's military mobilization and recruitment.

entries.title: Noma, voted the world's best restaurant, to close for regular service at the end of 2024
entries.description: Topping the world's best restaurant list five times, the restaurant said they were 'beginning a new chapter.'

entries.title: Iran protests: Two more men hanged in campaign to silence dissidents
entries.description: Four protesters have been executed since the uprising began in the country. At least 80 others are at risk of being executed.

entries.title: In Texas, Joe Biden finally addresses the immigration issue
entries.description: The US president's trip to the border with Mexico on Sunday came after the announcement of emergency immigration measures, as the White House tries to counter accusations of inaction.

entries.title: Death of Gianluca Vialli: Tributes abound in Italy for the former Sampdoria, Juve and Chelsea striker
entries.description: The Italian footballer, who died at the age of 58, suffered from pancreatic cancer, which forced him to retire from the national team in December 2022.

entries.title: 'Presenting the pension reform as fair to women is a lot of hogwash'
entries.description: In an article for 'Le Monde,' researcher Christiane Marty highlights that the size of pension paid to women is 40% lower than to men, a problem being overlooked by reforms.

entries.title: Billionaire Czech ex-PM Babis acquitted in EU fraud case
entries.description: Mr. Babis, who is currently running for president, was charged with removing a farm from his expansive holdings to make it eligible for a small business subsidy.

entries.title: Alleged horsemeat fraud on trial in France
entries.description: Twenty-five people, vets, dealers and butchers, are accused of selling horsemeat from the pharmaceutical industry even though it was unfit for human consumption.

entries.title: Israel's Ben-Gvir bans Palestinian flag-flying in public
entries.description: The announcement made by Israel's national security minister on Sunday is the latest crackdown on Palestinians by the country's new hard-line government.

entries.title: Iranian nuclear deal: The impossibility of failure
entries.description: Although Iran continues to pursue its nuclear program and flout the terms of the international agreement, the West continues to try to talk with the regime to avoid the worst, even during this period of repression in the country.

entries.title: In Brazil, an 'unprecedented' attack on democracy
entries.description: Supporters of former president Jair Bolsonaro stormed the places of power in the Brazilian capital on Sunday before being dislodged by the police.

entries.title: Cargo vessel runs aground in Suez Canal
entries.description: In March 2021, a massive 220,000-ton tanker called Ever Given got stuck across the Suez Canal for six days, causing its longest-ever closure and holding up some $60 billion of trade.

entries.title: 90% of people in one China province infected with Covid, says local official
entries.description: Data from the health commission for central Henan province states 88.5 million people in the province may now have had the virus.

entries.title: Kinshasa drowns under a sea of plastic waste
entries.description: Since the beginning of the rainy season, plastic waste has been piling up in the Congolese capital, causing severe flooding and land subsidence.

entries.title: Madagascar: 'If we are miserable today, it's not France's fault'
entries.description: 'From Dakar to Djibouti, a tour of the Africa-France relationship' (10/11). Ketakandriana Rafitoson believes that if France wants to have a genuine relationship with the Malagasy people, it must hold to account those who plunder Madagascar.

entries.title: How UK unions rediscovered their bargaining power
entries.description: Following a period of declining influence, unions are coordinating their actions in the face of the current crisis and starting to obtain results.

entries.title: 'Didier Deschamps, a coach without great genius, is nevertheless one of the best coaches in history'
entries.description: Despite an exceptional sporting record as head of the French team, the coach's contract renewal until 2026 still exasperates his critics.

entries.title: The pernicious effects of abortion restrictions in Poland
entries.description: Since January 2021, at least three women have died as a result of being denied a therapeutic abortion.

entries.title: Pension reform: 'What if we gave French seniors the choice of retiring between 62 and 67?
entries.description: Economists Nicolas Moreau and Elena Stancanelli refute the arguments justifying the postponement of the retirement age to 65 years.

entries.title: 'Spare': The biography of Prince Harry accused of weakening the British monarchy
entries.description: The avalanche of revelations made by the 'royal rebel' has made the royal family even more vulnerable than before the coronation of Charles III.

entries.title: Should we abandon New Year wishes and resolutions?
entries.description: Psychoanalyst Claude Halmos considers the impact of social conventions on those who may be feeling vulnerable due to psychological or material challenges.

entries.title: Mbappé accuses FFF president of 'disrespect' towards 'legend' Zidane
entries.description: In an interview, French football president Noël Le Graët said he 'wouldn't have even taken his (Zidane's) call' when asked whether Zidane had called him to express interest in taking over as French coach.
